name: dropbox-create-a-text-file
description: Creates a brand new text file from plain text content you specify. [See the documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesUpload__anchor)

path.description: Type the folder name to search for it in the user's Dropbox. If not filled, it will be created in the root folder.

content.description: The content of your new file

path.description: Type the folder name to search for it in the user's Dropbox. If not filled, it will be created in the root folder.

autorename.description: If there's a conflict, have Dropbox try to autorename the folder to avoid the conflict.

name: dropbox-create-or-append-to-a-text-file
description: Adds a new line to an existing text file, or creates a file if it doesn't exist. [See the documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesUpload__anchor)

path.description: Type the folder name to search for it in the user's Dropbox. If not filled, it will be created in the root folder.

name: dropbox-delete-file-folder
description: Permanently removes a file/folder from the server. [See documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesDeleteV2__anchor)

path.description: Type the file or folder name to search for it in the user's Dropbox.

name: dropbox-download-file-to-tmp
description: Download a specific file to the temporary directory. [See the documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesDownload__anchor).

name.description: The new name of the file to be saved, including it's extension. e.g: `myFile.csv`

name: dropbox-list-file-folders-in-a-folder
description: Retrieves a list of files or subfolders in a specified folder [See the documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesListFolder__anchor)

path.description: Type the folder name to search for it in the user's Dropbox.

recursive.description: If `true`, the list folder operation will be applied recursively to all subfolders and the response will contain contents of all subfolders.

includeDeleted.description: If `true`, the results will include files and folders that used to exist but were deleted.

includeHasExplicitSharedMembers.description: If `true`, the results will include a flag for each file indicating whether or not that file has any explicit members.

includeMountedFolders.description: If `true`, the results will include entries under mounted folders which includes app folder, shared folder and team folder.

includeNonDownloadableFiles.description: If `true`, include files that are not downloadable, i.e. Google Docs.

name: dropbox-list-file-revisions
description: Retrieves a list of file revisions needed to recover previous content. [See the documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesListRevisions__anchor)

mode.description: Determines the behavior of the API in listing the revisions for a given file path or id. In `path` (default) mode, all revisions at the same file path as the latest file entry are returned. If revisions with the same file id are desired, then mode must be set to `id`.

limit.description: The maximum number of revision entries returned.

name: dropbox-move-file-folder
description: Moves a file or folder to a different location in the user's Dropbox [See the documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesMoveV2__anchor)

pathFrom.description: Type the file or folder name to search for it in the user's Dropbox.

pathTo.description: Type the folder name to search for it in the user's Dropbox.

autorename.description: If there's a conflict, have Dropbox try to autorename the folder to avoid the conflict.

allowOwnershipTransfer.description: Allow moves by owner even if it would result in an ownership transfer for the content being moved. This does not apply to copies.

name: dropbox-rename-file-folder
description: Renames a file or folder in the user's Dropbox [See the documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesMoveV2__anchor)

pathFrom.description: Type the file or folder name to search for it in the user's Dropbox.

newName.description: The file's new name (make sure to include the file extension).

autorename.description: If there's a conflict, have Dropbox try to autorename the folder to avoid the conflict.

allowOwnershipTransfer.description: Allow moves by owner even if it would result in an ownership transfer for the content being moved. This does not apply to copies.

name: dropbox-restore-a-file
description: Restores a previous file version. [See the documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesRestore__anchor)

path.description: Type the file name to search for it in the user's Dropbox.

name: dropbox-search-files-folders
description: Searches for files and folders by name. [See the documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesSearchV2__anchor)

path.description: Type the folder name to search for it in the user's Dropbox.

orderBy.description: By default, results are sorted by relevance.

fileStatus.description: Restricts search to the given file status.

filenameOnly.description: Restricts search to only match on filenames.

fileCategories.description: Restricts search to only the file categories specified. Only supported for active file search.

fileExtensions.description: Restricts search to only the extensions specified. Only supported for active file search.

includeHighlights.description: Whether to include highlight span from file title.

name: dropbox-upload-file
description: Uploads a file to a selected folder. [See the documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesUpload__anchor)

path.description: Type the folder name to search for it in the user's Dropbox. If not filled, it will be created in the root folder.

name.description: The name of your new file (make sure to include the file extension).

filePath.description: Provide either a file URL or a path to a file in the /tmp directory (for example, /tmp/myFile.pdf).

autorename.description: If there's a conflict, have Dropbox try to autorename the folder to avoid the conflict.

mute.description: Normally, users are made aware of any file modifications in their Dropbox account via notifications in the client software. If `true`, this will not result in a user notification.

strictConflict.description: Be more strict about how each WriteMode detects conflict. For example, always return a conflict error when mode = WriteMode.update and the given "rev" doesn't match the existing file's "rev", even if the existing file has been deleted. This also forces a conflict even when the target path refers to a file with identical contents.

mode.description: Selects what to do if the file already exists.

name: dropbox-upload-multiple-files
description: Uploads multiple file to a selected folder. [See the documentation](https://dropbox.github.io/dropbox-sdk-js/Dropbox.html#filesUpload__anchor)

path.description: The folder to upload to. Type the folder name to search for it in the user's Dropbox.

filesPaths.description: Provide an array of either file URLs or paths to a files in the /tmp directory (for example, /tmp/myFile.pdf).

filenames.description: An array of filenames for the new files. Please provide a name for each URL and/or Path. Make sure to include the file extensions.

autorename.description: If there's a conflict, have Dropbox try to autorename the file to avoid the conflict.

mute.description: Normally, users are made aware of any file modifications in their Dropbox account via notifications in the client software. If `true`, this will not result in a user notification.

strictConflict.description: Be more strict about how each WriteMode detects conflict. For example, always return a conflict error when mode = WriteMode.update and the given "rev" doesn't match the existing file's "rev", even if the existing file has been deleted. This also forces a conflict even when the target path refers to a file with identical contents.

mode.description: Selects what to do if the file already exists.
